description: go spec: emphasize corner case w/ a comment

messages.text:
Hello rsc (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

The new comment makes it sound like that validity is
an exception, like a[0 : len(a)] would not be valid
when a is nil but a[:] is fine.  We've already said
that a nil slice is a 0-length slice.  I am not sure
we should try to keep calling out nils, because it
makes people think they are more different than they
actually are.

Russ

subject: code review 5299049: go spec: emphasize corner case w/ a comment
